meanings.definition: To throw or cast something forcefully.
meanings.sent1: He decided to jaculate the ball towards the goal.
meanings.sent2: She jaculated the paper airplane across the room.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to jaculate the rabbit out of his hat, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: The volcano began to jaculate hot lava into the air.
meanings.sent5: The chef jaculated the ingredients into the pot, creating a delicious soup.

meanings.definition: To emit or shoot out suddenly.
meanings.sent1: The car suddenly jaculated smoke from its engine.
meanings.sent2: The water gun jaculated a stream of water at the target.
meanings.sent3: The joke made him jaculate soda out of his nose from laughing so hard.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks jaculated colorful sparks into the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The flower jaculated pollen when touched by a bee.
